titleStmt.title: Right trusty and welbeloved we greet you & well
titleStmt.author: Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by John Bill and Christopher Barker,

notesStmt.note: Sent by Charles II to the lord mayor of London to secure funds to buy hemp and clapboards for unemployed to make fish-nets and barrels to supply ships going to fishing grounds.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
